list_definition.definition: a small black-topped lump in a pore of the skin, especially of the face

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a facial mask for cleansing blackheads.

list_ex_of_english: A comedo can be open (blackhead) or closed by skin (whitehead), and occur with or without acne.
A comedo may be open to the air (blackhead) or closed by skin (whitehead).
Oxidation rather than poor hygiene or dirt causes blackheads to be black.
The nematode causes a disease condition called toppling or blackhead disease in plants.
They are often confused with blackheads, a type of comedo.
Blackheads can be removed across an area with commercially available pore-cleansing strips or the more aggressive cyanoacrylate method used by dermatologists.
For this reason, those who frequently erupt with whiteheads or blackheads are advised to avoid topical use of this substance on the skin.
A characteristic symptom of the infection is the development of cyanotic (bluish) discoloration on the head, giving rise to the common name of the disease, blackhead.
